**[[Ted Cruz]] and ten of his compatriots in the Senate announced that they will support the rejection of Biden electors.<ref>{{cite web |last1=EVERETT |first1=BURGESS |title=At least 12 GOP senators to challenge Biden's win |url=https://www.politico.com/news/2021/01/02/ted-cruz-electoral-college-challenge-453430 |website=POLITICO |publisher=POLITICO LLC |access-date=3 January 2021}}</ref> Vice President Pence also endorses the move.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Zurcher |first1=Anthony |title=Biden election: Mike Pence 'welcomes' senators' bid to derail result |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/election-us-2020-55517626 |website=BBC news |publisher=The BBC |access-date=3 January 2021}}</ref>

**[[Mitt Romney]] and several of his colleagues announce that they will vote to Accept the Biden electors,<ref>{{cite web |last1=Vlamis |first1=Kelsey |title=Mitt Romney and other GOP senators say they will oppose an effort by their colleagues to challenge the election results |url=https://www.businessinsider.com/romney-toomey-murkowski-oppose-gop-effort-to-contest-election-results-2021-1 |website=Business Insider |publisher=Business Insider |access-date=3 January 2021}}</ref> explaining that rejecting them would "dangerously threatens our Democratic Republic,"
